title:
Contact solitons as spin pistons in one-dimensional ferromagnetic
  channels
abstract:
Ferromagnetic channels subject to spin injection have been theoretically
shown to sustain dissipative exchange flows (DEFs). In the strong injection
regime, a soliton is stabilized at the injection site, which has been termed a
contact soliton DEF or CS-DEF. Here, we investigate the modulation of CS-DEFs
as a mechanism to inject magnons into a DEF. By varying the injection current,
the parameters connecting the soliton with the DEF via a boundary layer are
varied. These lead to a modification in the DEF which is interpreted as a spin
piston. The injected magnons follow the expected dispersion relation of DEFs,
akin to the Bogoliubov - de Gennes dispersion relation. This work demonstrates
that changes in the injected current can pumping magnons along a ferromagnetic
channel via dissipative exchange flows.
